Improved Decision-making for Climate Resilient Development in Asia and the Pacific                                      
Knowledge and Support Technical Assistance (KSTA) 54412-001 
CONTRIBUTION TO STRATEGY 2030 OPERATIONAL PRIORITIES 
 
Corporate Results Framework 
OP  Indicators 
No.  (Outputs and Outcomes)  Expected Value  Methods and Comments 
2.3.1  Women  with  strengthened  147  DMF output indicators 1c and 1d will 
leadership capacities (number)   target  at  least  40%  women 
participants, who will be trained and 
engaged on discussions related to 
climate  risks-informed  decision-
making, and increase their potential 
leadership skills.  
 
 
3.2.2  Gender-inclusive  climate  and  28  DMF indicators 1c, 1d, 2a, 2b and 2c 
disaster  resilience  capacity    refer  to  trainings,  dialogues, 
development  initiatives    workshops, and knowledge sharing 
implemented (number)    events related to climate resilience 
and climate risk-informed decision-
making  ensuring  participation 
among  women  and  other 
stakeholders. 
 
 
3.2.4  National and subnational disaster  9  DMF outcome indicator will support 
  risk  reduction  and/or    the  implementation  of  national 
  management plans supported in    climate  adaptation  plans  in  3 
  implementation (number)    developing  member  countries  and 
      inform policies through the tools to 
      be  developed  under  the  technical 
    assistance.  DMF  1a  and  1b 
    indicators refer to reports which will 
  provide  guidance  in  integrating 
  climate risk considerations in fiscal 
  policy and management processes, 
  and national sector-specific reports 
  to  guide  climate  resilient 
development  pathways  with 
mapping of potential investments. 
 
 
6.1.1  Government  officials  with  324  DMF indicator 1c and 1d will target 
increased  capacity  to  design,    government officials as participants 
implement, monitor, and evaluate    for  trainings  and  inter-agency 
relevant measures (number)    coordination  meetings  which  will 
  increase their knowledge to design, 
implement,  monitor,  and  evaluate 
programs and policies using climate 
risk-informed  planning  tools  and 
guidelines. 
 
DMF = design and monitoring framework, OP = operational priority. 
Source: Asian Development Bank.
